text: In the United States, the International Space Station will pass over New York at 03/15/24 14:30:00 EST, marking its 100,000th orbit around Earth.
The European Space Agency's Mars Express will reach its closest approach to Earth on 15/03/24 16:45:00 CET, visible from Paris, France.
Japan's Hayabusa2 mission will return to Earth's orbit on 2024/03/15 08:20:00 JST, carrying samples from asteroid Ryugu.
The Chinese space station Tiangong will complete its solar panel alignment on 2024-03-15 19:30:00 CST, optimizing power generation.
India's Chandrayaan-3 will enter lunar orbit on 15.03.24 12:15:00 IST, beginning its mission to study the Moon's south pole.
Russia's Soyuz spacecraft will dock with the ISS at 15.03.2024 10:45:00 MSK, delivering three new crew members.
Brazil's first satellite launch of 2024 is scheduled for 15/03/24 13:20:00 BRT, marking the country's entry into the space race.
South Korea's Naro rocket will launch from Naro Space Center on 2024.03.15 09:30:00 KST, carrying a new weather satellite.
The United Arab Emirates' Hope Probe will reach Mars orbit on 15-03-2024 17:45:00 GST, beginning its atmospheric study.
Australia's first lunar rover will land on the Moon at 15/03/24 11:20:00 AEST, marking a new era in space exploration.
Canada's first space tourism flight will depart from Vancouver at 2024-03-15 15:30:00 PST, carrying civilian astronauts.
Mexico's first satellite constellation will be deployed on 15/03/2024 14:15:00 CST, providing nationwide internet coverage.
South Africa's space agency will launch its first Mars mission on 2024.03.15 18:45:00 SAST, joining the interplanetary race.
Israel's Beresheet 2 lunar lander will touch down on the Moon at 15-03-24 16:30:00 IST, attempting a historic landing.
The United Kingdom's first spaceport will open in Scotland on 15.03.2024 13:45:00 GMT, marking a new era in British spaceflight.
Germany's first private space company will launch its rocket on 15.03.24 10:20:00 CET, from a new spaceport in the North Sea.
Italy's first space station module will be installed on 24/03/15 09:15:00 CET, expanding the International Space Station.
Spain's first Mars rover will begin its mission on 15-03-2024 12:30:00 CET, exploring the Red Planet's surface.
The Netherlands' first space telescope will be deployed on 2024/03/15 11:45:00 CET, studying distant galaxies.
Sweden's first satellite launch will occur at 2024-03/15 14:20:00 CET, from the new Esrange Space Center.
France's first space station module will be installed on 15/03/24 15:30:00 CET, expanding the European orbital presence.
Poland's first satellite will be launched on 24.03.15 13:15:00 CET, marking its entry into the space industry.
Turkey's first spaceport will open on 15-03-2024 16:45:00 TRT, enabling domestic satellite launches.
Singapore's first space telescope will be deployed on 2024/03/15 10:30:00 SGT, studying exoplanets.
New Zealand's first rocket launch will occur at 15/03/24 17:20:00 NZST, from the Mahia Launch Complex.
Norway's first space station will be deployed on 15.03.2024 14:45:00 CET, monitoring Arctic weather patterns.

Denmark's first space telescope will be launched on 15-03-24 11:15:00 CET, studying dark matter.

Greece's first space mission will launch on 15.03.24 13:30:00 EET, studying solar activity.

Austria's first space telescope will be deployed on 2024.03.15 14:30:00 CET, mapping the universe.
